title: Riots on the third party app LSI

embed.description: Yes. Riot has confirmed multiple times that LSI has the same status as most other 3rd party services such as LoL Replay, lolking, quickfind, lolnexus etc.; meaning that while they might impose a violation of the terms of use Riot is aware of that and chose not to enforce.

body:
Hey riot,
I know the company has a strict stance on third party applications, and I was wondering if LoL summoner information (app),  is acceptable to use?
Thanks 
AT0MIC

replies.body:
Not a red, but a thing i want to go over.

>Yes. Riot has confirmed multiple times that LSI has the same status as most other 3rd party services such as LoL Replay, lolking, quickfind, lolnexus etc.; meaning that while they might impose a violation of the terms of use Riot is aware of that and chose not to enforce. Obviously use is at your own risk though; neither Riot nor LSI can be held liable for any unexpected side effects.

The difference between these and this LSI from what i can tell, is that these don't modify any files, i'm pretty sure this looks like something that is intent on doing so (death recap and a change to what you see with the score board, if this is an overlay it might be allowed but i don't think it is given it would have to work off in game data).
